Sanjeev wrote:
> 
> 
> Hi,
> I am try to run junit cases using ant,following is my pkg structure
> 
> EJBTesting
>   EJBTests
>    EjbTest
>      src
>        AllTests
>           AllEJBTests.java
>           AllEJBTests.class
>        build.xml
> 
> In build.xml,i am trying to run AllAEJBTests.java like this
> 
> <target name="runtest">
>             <junit printsummary="yes" fork="yes"
> haltonfailure="yes">
>               <formatter type="plain"/>
>               <test
> name="EJBTesting.EJBTests.EjbTest.src.AllTests.AllEJBTests"/>
>             </junit>
> </target>
> 
> But its throwing me following exception
> 
> java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:
> EJBTesting.EJBTests.EjbTest.src.AllTests.AllEJBTests
>       at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:199)
>       at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
>       at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:187)
>       at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:289)
>       at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass
> (Launcher.java:274)

Do you know how to set up a Java classpath? If not, I recommend reading 
a tutorial (search the web) for details and understanding how even basic 
classpaths work.

The short answer is this: "EJBTesting/EJBTests/EjbTest/src" is not a 
Java package, but just a directory on the file system. If you put that 
directory on your classpath, then the fully-qualified class name will 
just be AllTests.AllEJBTests.
--
